g.text: "Understanding page layouts through algorithmic structure analysis"
Key Challenge: Extract, compare, and cluster page structures at scale with minimal storage
GAP: No structure storage or comparison yet
XPath sequences vs. tree fingerprints vs. structural
embeddings? Trade-offs: size, compare speed, accuracy
Edit distance vs. Jaccard vs. custom DOM distance?
Must handle insertions, deletions, and reordering
Need to handle unknown K, streaming data
Full structure vs. signature vs. reference + delta?
How to derive a template from similar pages?
Mask variable content, preserve structure invariants
Store ordered list of XPaths to content elements:
‚Ä¢ Normalize: strip [1] indices, use tag-only paths
‚Ä¢ Hash prefix: first 3 levels as quick filter
Good for: debugging, small datasets, exact matching
Poor for: scale, fuzzy clustering, template learning
Recommendation: Use as debug layer, not primary
Strip all text/attributes, keep only tag hierarchy:
Serialize as parenthesized string or byte array
2. Byte array: tag‚Üíbyte map, depth bytes ‚Üí ~150B
Best: byte array + MinHash for clustering
Good for: clustering, template detection, scale
Combine with: semantic hints from class names
Combine multiple signals into fixed-size fingerprint:
40 bytes total ‚Ä¢ O(1) compare ‚Ä¢ Tunable weights
Extends existing L1/L2 without breaking changes
‚Ä¢ XOR L1 hashes ‚Üí hamming ‚â§ threshold ‚Üí candidate
assign S to best, update centroid
else: create new cluster with S
‚Ä¢ Telemetry: cluster stats, new layout alerts
‚Ä¢ Identify variable vs. fixed content regions
‚Ä¢ Golden set: 100 pages from 10 domains, manually labeled
‚Ä¢ Similarity matrix: verify cluster cohesion visually
‚Ä¢ A/B comparison: new layout detection rate
Processing time: ~5ms total | Storage: signature + cluster_id per page
New cluster creation triggers alert for manual review
